definition: circumstances require action (idiom); absolutely necessary/imperative
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
certainly/must/will/necessarily

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: It was concluded that it is imperative to set up standard on evaluation of sludge compost maturity.
sentences.chinese: 指出在我国建立一套堆肥腐熟度评价标准势在必行。

sentences.english: Thus, it is necessary for everyone to economize on water resources.
sentences.chinese: 因而节约水资源对每个人来说都势在必行。

sentences.english: Therefore, to timely collect environmental taxation is imperative.
sentences.chinese: 因而，适时征收环境税已势在必行。

sentences.english: In new period, facing so many problems, the reform is pre-requisite.
sentences.chinese: 面对自身存在的问题，教师口语课程改革势在必行。

sentences.english: Regaining the mantle of England's most decorated champions from Manchester United is imperative.
sentences.chinese: 从曼联手中夺回英国最显赫的锦标，势在必行。

sentences.english: So, it is imperative to solve the intonation problem in chorus.
sentences.chinese: 因此，解决合唱中的音准问题势在必行。

sentences.english: It’s also imperative to nurture your relationship with your spouse.
sentences.chinese: 处理好你和你的配偶之间的关系也是势在必行的。

sentences.english: Therefore, the design of the quick-start controller is the inevitable trend.
sentences.chinese: 因此，设计与之配套的快启控制器势在必行。

sentences.english: It is of great necessity to reform literature teaching in the new changing educational conditions.
sentences.chinese: 在新的教育形势下，文学课改革势在必行。

sentences.english: Therefore, the reconstruction of scope of accepting cases of administrative litigation is imperative.
sentences.chinese: 因此，重构行政诉讼法受案范围势在必行。

sentences.english: It is imperative to reform the allocating standard of manufacture expenses.
sentences.chinese: 改革制造费用分配标准势在必行。

sentences.english: But be imperative, shilly-shally heart going to tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 可惜势在必行，犹豫不决的心里打算明天再想。

sentences.english: As a result, the abolition of restrictions on second-hand housing-related policy is imperative.
sentences.chinese: 因此，取消二手房相关限制政策势在必行。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is very imperative for us to reform our country's civil trial by default system.
sentences.chinese: 因此，改革我国的民事缺席审判制度势在必行。

sentences.english: It is necessary to improve the system of criminal witness regulation in our country.
sentences.chinese: 目前，完善我国刑事证据规则体系已势在必行。

definition: pressing in on one's eyelashes (idiom); imminent
general trend/irresistible trend
to brook no delay/to demand immediate action
top priority job/matter of vital importance
to be bound to/undoubtedly will
of the utmost importance/of highest priority
to urgently need/urgent need
sensible act
the road one must follow or take/the only way
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
urgency
at the present stage
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
see 急待[ji2 dai4]
